ngiemboon: Samîɛ la kaa ncʉ́ŋ mevɛ́ olive, ḿpfɛte twó Saẅi. Pɔ́ ye fáŋte mennɛ́, á gɔɔn né Saẅi ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔʼɔ́ gú ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ gẅie à ge sáʼ pʉ̀a pé.
en: Samuel took the flask of oil,   poured it out on Saul’s head,  # 10:1 2Kg 9:1–3 kissed him, and said, “Hasn’t the Lord anointed you  # 10:1 1Sm 16:13; 26:9; 2Sm 1:14 ruler over his inheritance?  # 10:1 LXX adds And you will reign over the Lord’s people, and you will save them from the hand of their enemies all around. And this is the sign to you that the Lord has anointed you ruler over his inheritance.,# 10:1 Dt 32:9; Ps 78:71

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, é gʉa, é kú gyá mbàŋa yépʉ́a, á ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè Lǎshÿɛ̂ á Tseletsa, á ndège láʼ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ. Pɔ́ ge shwóŋo gú ngie mé kéen ńgyá púɔ mezwě nzikáasè pie ɔ̀ ka gʉa léfaʼ la. Áa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn mbà tá gù kéen ńdege nò mǒ, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿbúʼu mbùm ye ńtíi pɔ́ gẅí, ńne ńkwaŋa páʼ à ge gÿo púʼu tá gíŋe gyá míŋ we.
en: Today when you leave me, you’ll find two men at Rachel’s Grave   at Zelzah in the territory of Benjamin. They will say to you, ‘The donkeys you went looking for have been found,  # 10:2 1Sm 9:3–5 and now your father has stopped being concerned about the donkeys and is worried about you, asking: What should I do about my son? ’

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge fó ndège láʼ, é giŋ tà ntyě sag, é kúu tsìŋe tÿǒ gie áa Tambɔɔ, mé tóŋ lê shÿɛ̂n, é gyá mbàŋa yétá gie é ne ḿbʉʉ né jʉʼʉ ssé, á Mbetɛɛ; ndùŋmvfò nyìŋ gẅiin púɔ mvfó yétá, mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gẅiin mbelég ntáʼ tá, mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gẅiin ntúʼ melùʼ.
en: “You will proceed from there until you come to the oak of Tabor.   Three men going up to God at Bethel  # 10:3 Gn 28:19; 35:1,3,7 will meet you there, one bringing three goats, one bringing three loaves of bread, and one bringing a clay jar of wine.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo zɛ́te gú ngie ɔɔ ntentʉ́ wɔ́ɔ, é leen ké ná mbelég mbuʼú mbʉ́a né gù, ɔ̀ kẅé.
en: They will ask how you are and give you two loaves   of bread, which you will accept from them.

ngiemboon: É pɔ́ɔnte, é gʉa tà kúu Ngimbeya-Eloyim, á jʉʼ gie tsɔ́ nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Filisi ée wó. Ɔ̀ ge gwaa kúu tÿǒsoŋ, é pumte tsɔ́ nùɔ pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, pɔ́ ne fóo né jʉʼʉ ssé, ńne tsẅii nkʉ̀ ssé, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ mvfò, ńgẅiin kèkÿɛ́, mbɔɔ làmbì, mbɔɔ ndóŋ, ńgÿo mmó leluŋó gie mé tóŋ lê kèkÿɛ́ gie à gẅiin mepàg nkyɛ legém.
en: “After that you will come to Gibeah of God   where there are Philistine garrisons.  # 10:5 Or governors When you arrive at the city, you will meet a group of prophets  # 10:5 1Sm 19:20; 2Kg 2:3,5,15 coming down from the high place prophesying.  # 10:5 2Kg 3:15; 1Ch 25:1–6 They will be preceded by harps, tambourines, flutes, and lyres.

ngiemboon: Azẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ kúu na gù, pi lâ pɔ̌ leen ḿbú ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé, ɔ̀ piŋ ńkúbe ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ.
en: The Spirit of the Lord will come powerfully on you,   you will prophesy with them,  # 10:6 Ec 9:10 and you will be transformed.  # 10:6 1Sm 19:23–24

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn meliŋé lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńcʉate na gù, ɔ̀ gÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin légÿo, mélàʼmie e Ssé ée né gù.
en: When these signs have happened to you, do whatever your circumstances require  ,# 10:7 Jos 1:5 because God is with you.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo cwóŋ vɔgɔ Ngilengaa tá mèŋ n tó ńkẅɛ́te gú, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm tà mbɔɔ shúm pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo zẅíʼte wɔ́ɔn lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, tá mèŋ tó ńkẅɛ́te gú, é shwóŋo gú mmó gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo.
en: Afterward, go ahead of me to Gilgal. I will come to you to offer burnt offerings and to sacrifice fellowship offerings. Wait seven days until I come to you and show you what to do.”

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, Saẅi leen fó lejʉ́ŋ Samîɛ ńgʉa. E Ssé kúbe letʉ́m Saẅi pɔ́ fʉʼó, tá mɛ̌ meliŋé cʉate na yɛ̌ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ.
en: When Saul turned to leave Samuel, God changed his heart,   and all the signs came about that day.

ngiemboon: Saẅi pɔ́ ngàŋafàʼ we la gwɔ́ kúu Ngimbeya pâ tsɔ́ nùɔ pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pumte. À Zẅìge Ssé kúu na Saẅi, pâ pɔ̌ zye létsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: When Saul and his servant arrived at Gibeah, a group of prophets met him. Then the Spirit of God came powerfully on him, and he prophesied along with them.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie é la ne ńzsé Saẅi la gyá, á gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ patsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé ńne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ páʼ patsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la. Epʉ̀a ne sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Akɔ́ gÿǒ míŋ Kíshÿè? Saẅi aa páʼa mbà à kéen ńcʉ́ʼ yé ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé ka?
en: Everyone who knew him previously and saw him prophesy with the prophets asked each other, “What has happened to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets? ”

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pɔ́b zɛ́te ngie: «Nyìŋ gẅie à tsyeen wɔ́b aa wɔ̌?» Mé fó mǒ tá sag ngie: Saẅi aa páʼa mbà à kéen ńcʉ́ʼ yé ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé ka?
en: Then a man who was from there asked, “And who is their father? ”

ngiemboon: À la tsẅi nkʉ̀ ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńgʉa né jʉʼʉ ssé.
en: Then Saul finished prophesying and went to the high place.

ngiemboon: Afɛ̌ tá pà Saẅi zɛ́te Saẅi pɔ́ ngàŋafàʼ we ngie: Pi ka gʉa pɔ́ nzɔ̌? Saẅi tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Peg ka gʉa léfaʼ púɔ mezwě nzikáasè, táʼ, ńké te gyá, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ne mbʉ̀a Samîɛ.
en: Saul’s uncle   asked him and his servant, “Where did you go? ”

ngiemboon: Afɛ̌ tá pà Saẅi gɔɔn ngie: Tsétsɔʼ, laʼte wɔ́ɔn mmó gie Samîɛ ka gɔɔn né pi.
en: “Tell me,” Saul’s uncle asked, “what did Samuel say to you? ”

ngiemboon: Saẅi tsɔ́ʼ ngie: À ka cwoŋo shwóŋo wég ngie mé ka cʉ̌ʼ ńgyá púɔ mezwě nzikáasè. Táʼ, ńké te shwóŋo yé tsɔ́ nò na nò lefùɔ gie Samîɛ la gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Saul told him, “He assured us the donkeys had been found.” However, Saul did not tell him what Samuel had said about the matter of kingship.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la cúʼte pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ á tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a á Misepa,
en: Samuel summoned the people to the Lord at Mizpah

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Ayɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ zɔ la gÿo pa Ésàlayɛ fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ. N da kẅé gẅí mbwó pʉ̀a Egíbtò, mbɔɔ mbwó meláʼ ntsèm mie é la ne ńnẅɛɛ gẅí.
en: and said to the Israelites, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:   ‘I brought Israel out of Egypt, and I rescued you from the power of the Egyptians and all the kingdoms that were oppressing you.’

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, mbà pi kéen ńgwáʼ Ssé gi gie e la kẅé gẅí na mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ mí, mbɔɔ na mecʉanò mí ntsèm, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: náa weg fùɔ! Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi lu ssé ńtyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńtyé na mengẅɛ̀ mengẅɛ̀, mbɔɔ na páʼ mengẅɛ̀te mí gwɔ́.»
en: But today you have rejected your God,   who saves you from all your troubles and afflictions. You said to him, ‘You  # 10:19 Some Hb mss, LXX, Syr, Vg read You said, ‘No, you must set a king over us.’  # 10:19 1Sm 8:19 Now therefore present yourselves before the Lord by your tribes and clans.”  # 10:19 Jos 7:14–18; 24:1; Pr 16:33

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gÿo, epʉ̀a na mengẅɛ̀te pa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm cʉa ńtyé mvfò, á maʼa tyèente, á gwe na ngẅɛ̀te Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ gie Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ.
en: Samuel had all the tribes of Israel come forward, and the tribe of Benjamin was selected.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gÿo epʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀te Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ tó ńtyé mvfò, á na páʼ menkenkÿo tsìŋendá mɔ́b gwɔ́, e Ssé tsɔ́ʼ nkenkÿo tsìŋendá ye Mateli, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ wó, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ Saẅi míŋ Kíshÿè. Mé la ne faʼa yé táʼ, ńké te ne ńgyá yé wɔ́.
en: Then he had the tribe of Benjamin come forward by its clans, and the Matrite clan was selected.   Finally, Saul son of Kish was selected.  # 10:20–21 Jos 7:16–18 But when they searched for him, they could not find him.

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋe ńzɛ́te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ngie: «Mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ giŋé ńtóo jʉʼɔɔn ka?» Táʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: «Á lyeen tsetsɛ̀ɛ mepɔ̀ɔn.»
en: They again inquired of the Lord,   “Has the man come here yet? ”

ngiemboon: Mé kÿote ńgʉa fó tsoló ńkẅile yé, á leen ńké ńtyé soŋ láʼ, ésag ńcʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: They ran and got him from there. When he stood among the people, he stood a head taller than anyone else.  ,# 10:23 1Sm 9:2

ngiemboon: Samîɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ntsèm ngie: Pi ne ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka tsɔ́ʼɔ yé? Áa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ ntsèm, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ te páʼ yé wɔ́. Aláʼ ntsèm pú ńkwéʼe ngyè tetʉ̂, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «guugẅî mbwó fùɔ!»
en: Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see the one the Lord has chosen?   There is no one like him among the entire population.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ leen ńké shwóŋo láʼ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie fùɔ gẅiin légÿo, ḿbiŋ ńŋweʼe mɛ̌ menò tsɛ̀ɛ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne, ńnuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a. Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, á piŋe láʼ, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ piŋ né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Samuel proclaimed to the people the rights of kingship.   He wrote them on a scroll, which he placed in the presence of the Lord.  # 10:25 Dt 17:18–20 Then Samuel sent all the people home.

ngiemboon: Saẅi la piŋ né mbʉ̀a yé Ngimbeya. Ngàŋa shÿɔ̀g palÿɔ́ʼncù pie Ssé la náa mbwó yé la gʉa ńtsege yé.
en: Saul also went to his home in Gibeah,   and brave men whose hearts God had touched went with him.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pate zẅɛʼɛ́ wɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, á gÿo tà pege tsẅɛ́? Ńdeen ńké ńnyeme yé, tà pɔ́ té tsɔ́ mmó né yé ná. Táʼ, á ké te tsɔ́ nò gɔɔn.
en: But some wicked men said, “How can this guy save us? ” They despised him and did not bring him a gift,   but Saul said nothing.  # 10:27 DSS add Nahash king of the Ammonites had been severely oppressing the Gadites and Reubenites. He gouged out the right eye of each of them and brought fear and trembling on Israel. Of the Israelites beyond the Jordan none remained whose right eye Nahash, king of the Ammonites, had not gouged out. But there were seven thousand men who had escaped from the Ammonites and entered Jabesh-gilead.,# 10:27 Lit gift, and he was like a mute person
